website_summaries.verdict: Accessible, newer model phone system featuring 2 cordless handsets and answering machine.
pros: Two DECT 6.0 cordless phones featuring call waiting and caller ID
Backlit, large buttons, and audio assist offer ease-of-use for all ages

customer_reviews.title: Great phones, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Phones work great, excellent sound quality. Really convienant to be able to place remote handsets in multiple rooms. And you can use/talk on several handsets at the same time, great for families or groups of people talking. Speaker phone capability and answering machine work great. If you later want more handsets you can purchase more and sync them to your original base unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Mother is blind. Don'the use land line myself but ...
customer_reviews.text: Mother is blind. Don'the use land line myself but large buttons and audible who's calling was huge plus for her. Bought an extra handset after she used 3 pack set. She loves them and they are handicap friendly more so than phones I bought last time that were designed for blind people. Battery life still checking out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Weston

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised- much better range than my previous cordless system
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised- much better range than my previous cordless system. Really appreciate the large backlit numbers and display screen, and my husband and I get a kick out of the talking caller ID announcing every call. March 2018- editing my previous review because the phone suddenly has so much static-y noise on the line I can't use it anymore. Base unit and both accessory handsets. Thought at first it was the phone line and even called out a tech, but when we plugged in a corded phone the line was clear as day. Very disappointed! Owned a V-tech that was much cheaper that lasted over 10 years- guess I'm going back to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: A Burns

customer_reviews.title: Seniors! This one's the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: SENIORS!!! This is the phone for you! This is a beautiful phone. I love the color of the numbers when they light up. And the size of them. It has a button for Audio Assist that really helps you hear your caller. It didn't take very long to charge the phone. I just got it today and I haven't had to read the manual until it came to the ringer. And that was simple after reading them. Honestly this is the best phone I've ever had. The answering machine works great and the messages are easy to hear. I highly recommend this phone. I hope they don't quit making it.
customer_reviews.author: The Dog ZooTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Returned because of horrible speakerphone feature/quality
customer_reviews.text: I returned it because it was advertised as having a very good speakerphone in several places in the ad. That is what I was looking for. But the speakerphone quality, tone, and volume was far, far below average. Instead, I bought Amazon's Panasonic set. The Panasonics get a grade of C overall and when it comes to the speakerphone. I guess they don't make speakerphone features like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: STop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: What a great value. Excellent quality phone with nice features like ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great value. Excellent quality phone with nice features like voice caller ID and large readable numbers with back lighting for night time dialing. Good sound quality without being overly sensitive causing feedback like Panasonic telephones do. It actually has a sound adjustment (bass & treble) and volume. Nice wall mounting bracket. Really like this phone.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnathanAB

customer_reviews.title: Stopped taking messages.
customer_reviews.text: Worked at first. Now it doesn’t. Callers think they left me a message because appears to be taking a message, but nothing shows up on the display, all of that I missed a call. No messages are coming through. I plan to return this year.
customer_reviews.author: Jmrs1010

customer_reviews.title: Not happy. :(
customer_reviews.text: These phones are not good. They lose connection to base a lot (last phones I’ve owned NEVER did). They don’t dial a lot of the time. I’ll press for dial tone, then press phone number in and nothing. I’ll have to try calling 4 and 5 times sometimes until finally it will make the call. It happens with all the hand sets. Many times after dialing and a long pause it says “Unable to connect with base” or something similar. (Last phones never did). Redial doesn’t work a lot. Disappointed. I do like that the handsets announce the caller audibly! But the (cheesy) computer voice usually pronounces names wrong. Needs MUCH improvement. Should have sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: Pickles

customer_reviews.title: loses connection
customer_reviews.text: This is a new phone that I received not too long ago. I noticed the connection for some reason turns the phones off. Thank goodness I activated my Spectrum answering machine because that's is the only way I knew when someone was trying to get through. I then have to pick up a phone, hit on, hit off, hit on again for it to work. I was just diagosed with cancer and have doctor offices calling me and they are not getting through. I just ordered another set of phones and they are definitely not AT&T.
customer_reviews.author: MaryF

customer_reviews.title: Not a wired phone
customer_reviews.text: Our aged mother had real trouble operating these phones ... the display is not that easily read and the buttons not intuitive. The recording feature only works if you pay the phone company extra for voicemail. And, oddly enough, these traditional looking sets operate only with a modem ... so much for the alternative safety of plugging into a hard line. When she died, we had to give away the phones, and send the modem back to AT&T. That took 4 trips ... "but we require a serial number!", the FedEx people said. Of course it didn't have one.
customer_reviews.author: PenNM

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse is Hit and Miss
customer_reviews.text: I've had mixed experiences with Amazon Warehouse. This was a definite miss. The two phones showed up heavily used (dust in the back, paint chipped on the edges, one phone missing a back.) and one phone broken. It honestly looks like someone bought this phone and returned their old one. I brought the phone on vacation, so it isn't convenient to return it (plus I need it). Amazon gave me 50% credit, which was okay, but still leaves a bit of a sour taste in my mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly better than my last phones
customer_reviews.text: I've always read thru the "Best Cordless Phone of.." yearly lists, and have purchased Uniden & Panasonic sets in the past. But these AT&T phones are a cut above - solid construction ( the Pannys used to flex & squeak in your hand, very cheap feel, and sound quality was also poor). These are solid, have big clear buttons, sound quality is both adjustable and clear, even the digital answering machine has good clarity compared to many others I've owned. For 3 phones at this price, to me it is a no brainer. Am getting another set for my Mom who wearing hearing aids.
customer_reviews.author: Christidge

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.  Find something better than AT&T phones.
customer_reviews.text: We do like the bigger buttons and the fact that they light up. That's a definite plus. The answering machine works well. We bought this to replace our E5965C AT&T model. In fact, we would not have bought a new one if our old model hadn't bit the dust. The phones are very flimsy & chintzy compared to our old model. The voice is absolutely ridiculous. It sounds like something a 2 year old might record. It's very robotic. The voice on the E5965C was very clear and much louder. I would assume that AT&T would make their current models better than the older ones however, that is not the case. I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Zoo 2

customer_reviews.title: Phone no longer "works" after a year and a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: So very disappointed in these phones. About 3 months ago, the phone received messages but I was not able to get any of them, my code didn't work. I tried to reset everything, and that still didn't work. So now I can NOT even dial out with the phone....it just won't ring on the other line. I'm sorry to review this item with being able to find the seller first, but I can't. I would love to return the phones, but don't I just found out I missed that window of returning on December 18. Sheesh, wish I had asked for this sooner, now I'm out the money and a phone. Merry Christmas to me
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Branson

customer_reviews.title: Learn from my mistake: Believe the low ratings! I wish I had.
customer_reviews.text: I bought to this phone + answering machine system in August. By October the answering machine component of the system had entirely stopped working. Just wouldn't record calls. At all. Guess I'll be going back to the old mediocre-but-at-least-it-works Panasonic model I've used for all these years. Very disappointing, AT&T. Very, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: Excellent volume...
customer_reviews.text: I have a hearing problem and have tried a lot of different phones. I read a review on one of those phones and someone said, "don't waste your money on these expensive phones when you can buy the old AT&T phones." They were right! I'm amazed at how I can control the sound while someone is on the phone with me. It only has one drawback for me. I like to wear a headset to free up my hands, but there's no access point to put one in. But I can use the speaker phone if I want to.
customer_reviews.author: girluvsart

customer_reviews.title: Finally, Someone Sent A Phone Home With Their Staff First, THEN Sold It To Us!
customer_reviews.text: Best phones ( finally! ) we ever chose! Goodness, what an unexpected struggle and we really are not picky. This phone is clear, no static, picks up instantly ( no poking the green button 3 times while the other person hangs up ), managed to combine a lot of features without being confusing. Someone perfected this then sent it home with employees for a few months. It's the only answer to why there is finally a home phone easy to live with. Hate to leave a review which would cause someone to buy something they do not like- so please know no, we do not work for ATT!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Lane

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use and long lasting is a high value product that Claims Your Attention!!
customer_reviews.text: WE finally destroyed our old Clarity phone after many years of outside work, travel to many rooms for lengthy talks, and playing catch with it, with occasional fumbles by the object of the.call, calls at night with those big letters and numbers lighted up, and I could go on. We love this new phone set by AT&T and you will too, for a long, long time. Sound and tone quality is great and the size of the numerals/letters is a must for folks with some vision problem or for a time you can't find your glasses but need to make a quick call. Need a portable phone....buy Clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Donald P. Galamaga

customer_reviews.title: Great phone that has many features at a great price point.
customer_reviews.text: This phone has it all--answering machine with voicemail, 2 head sets so you can have one upstairs and one phone downstairs, & clear sound. I could not be more happier with this phone. It also shows caller id and through the speaker, if the caller can be ID'ed then it will voice out loud what their ID is. I would recommend this phone to everyone who is looking to replace their old handset.
customer_reviews.author: AK California

customer_reviews.title: No signal
customer_reviews.text: When I use the extra handset it will just shut off saying no signal. Doesn't happen often but it should never happen. Had ATT phones before this one and never had that happen. Would have sent this back but had already disposed of my old phones. Not the good product ATT use to be. UPDATE: Now the main phone says it's out of range right when I am standing right next to the base. Terrible product. Would never buy an att product again.
customer_reviews.author: Helga

customer_reviews.title: Phone answering machine
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my elderly mother's phone and she does not like to learnto use new things. The base is a bit lightweight. The telephone cord was to short and she had to use the one from the old machine. The electrical cord was ok. Shouldn't both be the same length? She also mention caller id voice is hard to understand.
customer_reviews.author: DJS

customer_reviews.title: The design of this system is quite nice with lots of features that probably are not needed
customer_reviews.text: The design of this system is quite nice with lots of features that probably are not needed. The only thing I do not like is that while I am talking to someone, the phone completely zeros out background noise of the party I have called, which can be a little funny as I am not sure anyone is there. It takes a few seconds for the receiving part of conversation to kick in so that sometimes when the other person starts talking, the phone has not kicked back into receiving so that the first couple of words gets chopped off, and you have to ask person to repeat. My old Uniden works better.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Senior

customer_reviews.title: My 80 yr old parent love them
customer_reviews.text: I vought these phones for my parents. They are in their 80s. The phone's numbers are easy to see and large. The ring is very audible and louder than the previous phone we had. I like the fact that the phone will announce the name of the person calling or the telephone number. I have got my parents to ignore numbers or names they are not familiar with. So this feature helps enormously. The font is also large enough that they can read it without issue. The colors are pretty and so far my parents love these phones
customer_reviews.author: Monica L

customer_reviews.title: Read the pros and cons and decide which matters to you
customer_reviews.text: It’s slime it’s up to you if you like it or not, the caller ID announcement if difficult to understand the Panasonic I had before this one translates the text much batter. But in teams of the volume of the call conversation it’s load which may be a big plus for some people, also the answering system is fully function from the headset which on the Panasonic is was only from the base, one other great future this is missing which I’ve seen on other phones the option to add a phone number to your block list as the call comes in which is very handy to easily block scammers, or unwanted sales call.
customer_reviews.author: Admin

customer_reviews.title: complicated phone
customer_reviews.text: The manual of instruction sis pretty good but it took me several readings and a couple of help emails to ATT to figure out how to make the answering machine work. Also, making a call from the speed dial is overly complicated and requires several steps. My old phone, all I had to do was press the first letter of the name I wanted to call and the speed dial went into action. Like many appliances nowadays, the phone is seriously over technical.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tom Baker

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good phone.
customer_reviews.text: The phone works ok and I was surprised to see that my wife could hear good with the phone. She says most phones do not have loud enough volume for her. The phone is a little complicated to use and the only problem with it is the ring volume. My wife does not have good hearing and when I call her from downtown she does not hear the phone ring. She heard our old phone ring ok. I would probably buy it again, because I doubt there is one better at a reasonable price. And I don't call her that much when she is home.
customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: I like the large keys, the large tax and the normal phone number directory and other things that this phone does. For somebody with eyesight difficulties it makes the phone experience much easier. I was so impressed that I advised my mother to get a set of her own. The only negative I can cite is reliability. I've had to replace the whole system because it just stopped working well. Shame on you AT & T. Shaky quality is not what I expected from you. Despite that. I was so enamored with the large keys and text that I bought another set anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Karen in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Non Functioning Buttons
customer_reviews.text: Amazon replaced the first one of these because of problems with it, namely that when you touched a number button it often didn't register causing one to go back and start over. Also it "cut in and out" not only on domestic calls but international as well. I had trouble hearing as the sound wavered....Amazon offered to replace it again but...I couldn't think that a third try would yield better results. What's sad is that this comes from AT&T, usual a reliable name. I gave it two stars as it worked more than 60% of the time but...when you think about it, for a phone to only work 60% of the time is acceptable. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Lew Troop

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone as a replacement for an existing system that we had used for years. Very easy to install and set up. My husband has limited vision and the large buttons make it easier for him to use. He loves the ease of using the speaker phone. One of the best features is the ease of using the caller ID call back feature. A lot less steps than the old unit. I would highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Nutter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We're going to return it. It's hard to hear, has cut off in the middle of conversations, sometimes won't give us a dial tone. Unfortunately, I assumed it would be good because it was AT &T & threw away the box. Maybe we just got a defective unit but if even 1 of the 3 phones won't do what it's supposed to, it's not a good value. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmaof4

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the models manufactured earlier
customer_reviews.text: The ATT Cordless phone with answering system has good sound quality and is easy to use. There is two drawbacks that have given me an issue. First is the time. I have tried to set it several times and after a few hours the hour changes. The second problem is the LED for the answering system is not large enough. It is a red LED and it can not be seen from across the room.
customer_reviews.author: DTW

customer_reviews.title: Can talk to my mother again
customer_reviews.text: My mother is 101, in an assisted living facility and has hearing problems. My sister and I were unable to talk to her on the phone because she could not understand us. We finally decided we would try a new phone. IT WORKED! We are now able to carry on a normal conversation. This is especially uplifting because we have not been able to see her for months. The buttons a large so she can see them and it has the options she needs and not all the extras to confuse her. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like this phone and find it to have better overall sound quality than my iPhone pro 11 max. My 1 gripe with the phone is that one of the phones seems to not work properly if trying to use keys while on speaker phone mode. Other than that, I think these are great phones.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The product comes with three hand units, and after 5 and a half months, one already failed - no dial tone. The voice quality is ok, but the buttons for deleting messages, screening calls, etc. are hard to use, not at all intuitive. The attendant who announces the incoming call has a robotic voice, so useless I just read from the small screen on the handset. I won't recommend this phone, ... well, ok, just to my enemy
customer_reviews.author: Skhuanoh

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked right now. I have never been sent an open box/used item from Amazon. It appears to be working but the box had clearly been opened because it wasn't closed properly and could not close flat. The seal tape had some pieces of the box on it. The phones looked clean and had plastic on it. The phones are as described but with static. I have had the experience of products not being as good as reviews described but not this. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Adel's Review

customer_reviews.title: I love my old Radio Shack one
customer_reviews.text: This is the third land line phone system I have bought in a month or so. I have returned two other bands and now I have this one. The hand sets are very light and they fall off the charger. Most of the "wonderful" things this phone does I do not understand nor do I need. It seems each brand is basically the same. I love my old Radio Shack one. But it does not work anymore and I can not get a new one. So I am stuck with this. I do not like carrying a cell phone around with me everywhere I go. I am keeping it, but would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie dean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The caller ID Announce isn't perfect, but it is nice to know that I don't have to run across the house to answer spam phone calls. Battery life on the handsets for looooong calls (two hours, plus) seems very good.
customer_reviews.author: SCheng

customer_reviews.title: Too late...
customer_reviews.text: I am accustomed to AT&T phones like this one. This one had sound issues. Worked slower than others I've had. After about a month or so, some of the #s begin to stick. Sad it was too late to return. Have just today received another AT&T phone ordered through Amazon...and it is MUCH better sound quality!! Cheaper and SHOCKED at how much better the sound is!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda P. Tapp

customer_reviews.title: I purchased for my Mother
customer_reviews.text: This set is perfect. My Mother is going to be 92 this year and struggles with anything electronic. The phones have relatively large print (big enough), large number keys and was really easy to set up. (I did the set up). The commands are easy enough for her and she hasn’t struggled with them at all. I’d purchase these phones again!
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good product for the price.... but...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hear and others can hear the conversation as well. Accessing items on the menu is not difficult, but the menu is not set up efficiently. The voice message playback sound quality is lacking some and the feature that calls out the name and/or phone number of an incoming call is of so poor sound quality, I am going to disable it. All in all, this is an okay item for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Buck

customer_reviews.title: Geat call-screening feature
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Large key size is a plus. What I like the most is the call screening feature. Once a junk call comes in and stays in after the message announcement, one can press the <SCREEN> button. That number will be screened out from then on. Granted it does not totally address the issue, it is at least someway of getting back at those pesky calls.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: ringer
customer_reviews.text: used for home use. the biggest problem encounterd is the riger volume. i replaced an older att+t model which worked great for years. new model features are almost identical with 1 exception. ican barely hear it. i have turned up the volume to max to no avail. is there something else i can do? other than that system is ok . i am a litte hard of hearing so this is very important to me. the oldermodel i could hear ring just fine. help!
customer_reviews.author: sam r.

customer_reviews.title: Bought these because of the moon child
customer_reviews.text: Frantic I searched for the missing handset. Sniffle drape I knew it was too late. The moon child had acquired the cosmic detractors and the hand set would be evermore banished to kremlin officials. One more for that side eyed donkey. High five friends look to the moon and whisper good night it’s not your fight. Lick the monkey foot and spit into your own mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Clutch Steed

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone but I don't like that every time a ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone but I don't like that every time a get a call and a hang up the machines saves it as a message. Wish there was a way to fix that. I don't care how many calls I have and hang ups only real message with someone actually talking. UPDATE It's now 5 months almost having this phone and I can can not delete a message it says deleted but the phone still flashes with one message. I have unplugged it and still flash. I am sorry I purchased this phone my other phone was 1/2 the price lasted 3 years no issues. This phone records messages anytime anyone calls and hangs up very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shop

customer_reviews.title: Great for older users!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 89 yr old mother-in-law. Audio quality is fine and she is mildly hearing impaired. Answering machine is easy for her. Nothing too fancy its without all the in excessive bells and whistles that have found their way into a basic phone nowadays! She loves the phone! Highly recommend for those in the world who still have a land line.
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: A T & T
customer_reviews.text: The phone quality is not as good as I would hope. Has a lot of static. One thing that is good for a laugh....when a call comes in there is a voice that announces who is calling. If you only listened to that...you would have no idea who it is. She pronounces the names totally incorrect and crazy. So funny.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy lou

customer_reviews.title: Defective in many ways.
customer_reviews.text: Third handset doesn't work. Unable to turn up the ringer volume very high. Unable to turn up handset volume so you can't have very well. When someone calls it announced the person and the volume won't go up so you cannot hear it. Unless some on is programmed into phone their phone number doesn't show. I ordered this for my quite elderly mother so was unable to get it through her due to covid. Pass the refund deadline. This is a terrible phone. I do not reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE AUDIO QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: The first think I noticed was that the phone has terrible ergonomics, it's top heavy with a skinny bottom which makes one handed dialing difficult. But the outstanding feature is horrid audio, sketchy and scratchy, dropping in and out even near the base - AND it cuts off your first word when on speaker, so if you answer YES to a caller, they don't hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Tikiman90

customer_reviews.title: Not Working
customer_reviews.text: Not Working after few hours of usage. One phone broke after 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Akiry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, user friendly!
customer_reviews.text: We are an older couple and don't enjoy learning to use newer "too technical" (you know?) things. We were quite worried about having to get a new phone system. This one is so easy to use, set up and understand... Oh Thank Heavens! We are delighted with it. What a relief! LOVE everything about it. I'd give it ten stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Voicemail Machine Broken! Won't stop making noise 10 minutes after caller leaves a voicemail!
customer_reviews.text: I've been having issues with the answering machine since I received this device. I was in the process of moving when I ordered it otherwise I would have reported this sooner! When a person calls and leaves a voicemail, the machine continues making noises and records long after the caller has completed his/her voicemail and hung up the phone. The voicemail machine then proceeds to make a loud screeching noise before a dial tone noise starts and lasts for multiple minutes. The voicemail machine starts making noise from the time a person calls until 10 minutes after the person has hung up, it is ridiculous! If this is some sort of setting, someone please advise! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Work good, but problems with interference
customer_reviews.text: These phones are easy to install...follow the instruction manual....but I have a problem with their frequency interfering with other remote transmitters/receivers that I use with my guitar amplifiers....and can't figure out how to change the frequencies, or if that is even possible....got myself a headache....but the phones to work good.
customer_reviews.author: John I.

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. Buttons stick and people say our volume fades in and out but not every time. This is the fourth time buying bad phones, I'm going to spend more money and hopefully get some quality phones. I wasn't even going to review this but they emailed and asked.
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Great  Home Telephone System
customer_reviews.text: All the features were great. The buttons are plenty large. The operation is simple and straight forward. I would have given this 5 stars but for 1 thing. The main base is small. Normally that would be a good thing but if your intention is to mount it to the wall, I doesn't cover the wall plate. Otherwise, it's a great set.
customer_reviews.author: TSM

customer_reviews.title: One phone stopped working completely. Other to take a long time to connect
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a senior center. The two phones we use regularly Have started taking a long time to answer or connect to a call. The third phone doesn’t work at all. Shame on you guys.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Simms Yingling

customer_reviews.title: NOT LOUD AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: I have an AT&T phone set that I have had about 7 years and that set is very clear and loud. I purchased this set for an older person who is hard of hearing and does not have a hearing aid. I feel very badly that I did this because almost any phone set delivers louder sound that this one.
customer_reviews.author: NC Granny

customer_reviews.title: 59 yo here/Good phone
customer_reviews.text: I can hear people now.Nice and clear well made.I actually had to turn it down.Decent display.big buttons.havent used caller id announce yet >I think I will.so I wont answer the bull crap calls.I didn't want call blocker.I did have one phone die on me.No hastle replacement in exactly 24 hours.Wow amazon.I dropped it of at amazon kiosk at kohls and boom, done.Very happy now that I can hear and that is the biggest thing with a phone.
customer_reviews.author: BORIS DIME

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Who really needs a phone to last more than a year or so in our disposable culture? I’ve never been happy with these at&t branded products. When my go-to phone manufacturer went out of business (I had 2 of their phones for 15 years) I tried several others. AT&T has been the best, but the competition wasn’t strong. I’d just like to get 5 years out of one of their phones.
customer_reviews.author: The Major

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality speakers
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with the "tinny", staticy quality of the speakers. The phones have many nice qualities i.e. large keys and a readable screen, but the whole purpose of the telephone is to communicate. If you can't hear clearly and are distracted by the unpleasant tone, conversation becomes distracted and much less enjoyable. I would've returned it if I hadn't already thrown away the box. I expected more from AT&T,.
customer_reviews.author: Val Lendaro

customer_reviews.title: Nice large buttons but....
customer_reviews.text: Nice large buttons but the speaker is not loud enough, clarity not good, even with the adjustment button on the side, sounds muffled when not on speaker. The handset does not stand up thus covering the speakers that are located on the back of the phone making it harder to hear the speaker. I regret not returning it while I could.
customer_reviews.author: scales in balance

customer_reviews.title: Changed from 2 stars to 4, but I still don't like the phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone base failed after 5 months. This may be a mixed blessing as we were not all that pleased with the phone itself: poor voice quality. We previously had a Panasonic & I guess that is what we will go back to. UPDATE: The phone base was OK - it turned out to be my OOMA device. I still don't like the phone & will keep the Panasonic replacement we just received.
customer_reviews.author: Don L.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Like having to hand-sets. Voice quality is fair to good (not great). The unit is new (used 1 week+ ). I am still learning it. Sometimes the handset resets to dial tone. And, I am not sure if I did it or the machine. Summary: It is fine for price paid (for now).
customer_reviews.author: Mad Beach

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a replacement for my father. These phones constantly drop calls. We have had all the interior and exterior wiring replaced. Additionally we purchased “hard” wired phones. Only when he talks on the cordless !phones does he “drop” calls. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Pat G

customer_reviews.title: No redial from out of town callers...
customer_reviews.text: The one thing that I stunt like about these phonesis that out of town numbers don't pull up on the caller ID with a 1 in front of the area code, so you can't just redial the number from the caller ID log. Its frustrating. Otherwise, they're decent phones. Redial holds up to about 10 numbers or so, which is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jane

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: Work requires we carry the store phone with us. I have tried many different phones and always end up butt dialing or bending over and hearing beep, beep... very annoying! With this phone I didn't butt dial or beep at all during my shift! So far sound is great, easy to set up! I also purchased a set of 3 for home. I will update in a few months!
customer_reviews.author: C Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Great Landline
customer_reviews.text: Fixes all the problems I had with my previous phone. I like that speaker phone is on both handsets, you can set number of rings before answering machine starts, it announces the caller, easy to read screen, handy remote access to answering machine....nothing I don't like.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Our previous at&t phone that was quite a few years old got water damaged so we figured this would be a good replacement. It isn’t. The sound quality is poor, cuts out a lot, but worst of all is the microphone, which really doesn’t work well for speakerphone unless it is right up by you, which kinda defeats the purpose of the speakerphone... I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have with this phone is that the charge does not last very long (more than a couple of days) and it takes a while to recharge as well. I like the caller ID feature when it tries to announce who is calling. I wish it was louder but its the first phone I ever had with an audible caller ID
customer_reviews.author: Idouglas99

customer_reviews.title: Reach Out And Touch Someone!
customer_reviews.text: AT&T phones are the choice of our family, we bought these to increase the amount of phones in our home. We originally had a 2 set set-up and this set tells you who’s calling, bigger letters for caller ID and a sleek black design. They range far from the main phone. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: SAS

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set-Up
customer_reviews.text: Given as a Christmas gift to a Senior who needs a landline due to location & avoids new technology (:-) - set-up was included by me. Have to admit, I haven't interacted with a cordless landline in years, but these were very easy to set-up, program & navigate through the phone menu. Her last set was also this brand just older version and very old.
customer_reviews.author: Upstate NYer

customer_reviews.title: Fine but not great
customer_reviews.text: This phone seems fine -- the handsets on our old cordless kept running out of battery, so we had to buy a new one. Sound quality is fine; volume is adjustable. I didn't realize that the base doesn't have a speaker option, which is what we relied on with the old phone when the batteries were running down. The programming is NOT intuitive, but the manual explains things pretty clearly.
customer_reviews.author: DC Gal

customer_reviews.title: Using the hand set
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this model because our previous phone only had one hand set. Setting this up was tricky because the instruction booklet did not give the steps to inputting the directory in an organized manner. ie.. Inputting each one was very time consuming. Suggestions: 1. Unable to change the entry/ies to be alphabetical. 2. The entry did not allow for a space and just ran the infotogether : JeffJonescell. 3. Each incoming call is read by Siri saying JeffJonescell. As a senior citizen who has never had basic operation failure/s using a new device. 4. I would also suggest the directory be able to categorize entries: Family, friends, doctors, business.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this phone, I had a V-tech and was having so many problems with it that I said that's it and dumped it. The set-up is so easy, the numbers are nice and big and I love how the numbers light up. I could not be happier. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Bertie 28

customer_reviews.title: Good but nothing to brag about!
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good buy at this price, but the firmware/software IS NOT very user friendly for elders (or even young people). Although AT&T is a world leader, they should learn from their competition. My mother's 8 years old Uniden has better and easier to use firmware that these, although the fact that they all sync automatically is nice! The best thing is the fact that the package has three handsets which is a plus for most people.
customer_reviews.author: Rom

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a previous AT&T model that died after 10+ years. I did not have any issues with setting it up and found that to be easy following the directions. My only complaint is that the message feature is extremely sensitive compared to the previous model I had and records just about every single hang up.
customer_reviews.author: ceshearin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound and no ability to block calls
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely disappointed by the tinny sound of voices, and people I talk with on the phone say the sound they hear is irritatingly bad as well. I should have noted all of the features on the phone before purchasing, but I assumed that all new phones in this price range have a call-block function. This one does not. All considered, this was an ill-advised purchase. I miss my old phone but am now stuck with this inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great phones.
customer_reviews.text: So far I am absolutely loving these phones. I had a Panasonic and they went out quickly. Maybe I'm just happy to have phones that work but so far these are awesome. The Panasonic 1 I had did have a block feature for spam and I do miss that a little bit but to have phones that work correctly is more important. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Honsey

customer_reviews.title: Nice Corless Phones
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I have one in my detached garage and it still makes connection into the house main base.
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: Good for the elderly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly parents and they love it. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Elated!
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone. The large keys so helpful to me. I have failing eyesight. The volume selection is perfect. Voices so clear with incoming calls. It is the perfect phone for me. I am more than pleased with my purchase. Oh yes, the cost makes it an exceptional buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Hudnall

customer_reviews.title: Phone begins to have issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought two units in February. I have one unit and my girlfriend has the second unit. Now in April, both units, are having issues. Base phone always shows "line in Use" even though not on phone. dial tone disappears or you get static on the headset. I thought might be my phone line,but girlfriends phone is behaving the same way. Can not dial out when phone is not properly working.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: Great For Older Adults
customer_reviews.text: Great For Older Adults. I purchased this for my mom and it has made it much easier for her make calls and receive calls.
customer_reviews.author: Mildred Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Robotic voice is HORRIBLE sounding and very poor word recognition
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice answering machine, but I initially only gave it a 3 because of when there is an incoming call, the answering machine speaks and says the name of the incoming caller and the robotic voice is HORRIBLE sounding and very poor word recognition. If I can shut this off, that would be great, found it, I think it defaults to voice ID, on page 9 of abridged instructions tells you how to shut it off
customer_reviews.author: DougK

customer_reviews.title: Volume VERY low
customer_reviews.text: The volume on this phone whether speaker or hand held is very low. The audio assist does not work at all. The "quiet" button does not work at all. I would not recommend this product and really wish I would have returned it!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Woodall

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality telephone
customer_reviews.text: This phone stopped working properly after about 4 months. Some incoming calls would not connect anymore including calls from my wifes doctors office. I will never bup another AT&T telephone again!
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality set. Lights up when dialing and has big numbers, great for elderly.
customer_reviews.author: Gh

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 89 year old mother who spends a lot of time talking on the phone. She loves the big buttons and the display and she says the sound quality is good. It is nice that it comes with 2 handsets as she can keep one right by her. Mom approved!
customer_reviews.author: Columbus George

customer_reviews.title: This phone was a disappointment from the start.
customer_reviews.text: The face of the headsets are difficult to read because the lighting behind the instructions were dim and small. It has been skipping messages, not ringing every time I have a call and the sound was fading in and out during conversations...In face, I ordered another set to replace it....very inconsistent performance.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Schampier

customer_reviews.title: Decent phone
customer_reviews.text: Not bad phone. Sound quality is ok. Loud enough for my senior citizen parents to hear. Large buttons and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: AT&T Phone - poor qualify sound
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these phones a year ago to replace our phones. My husband is hard of hearing and has trouble hearing on phones. Cordless speaker phones work best for him. The sound quality on these phones, especially at the louder levels, is horrible, making it hard to understand people. It is better at the mid-range but still not great We have trouble making calls, often we dial the number but the phone won't place the call. Sometimes we have to try 3 or 4 times and then place the phone back on the base and try again. I'm sorry I ever purchased these phones and have just replaced them with Panasonic phones
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Martorella

customer_reviews.title: This set of phones has been the Best solution to our home phone needs
customer_reviews.text: This set of phones has been the Best solution to our home phone needs. The base and phones have a solid look and feel, the speakerphone is pitch-perfect, and the backlit keypad is an added plus. We love the voice announcement telling us who is calling. We had a super cheap Big Lots phone before -- Happy we upgraded to this set and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: T. Frost

customer_reviews.title: All 3 handsets stopped working in less than 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: First one failed (shortly after Amazon return period), than the next, and finally all 3. AT&T support is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Wagner III

customer_reviews.title: Always good quality from AT&T.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it just four stars because to this day I haven’t been able to utilize the new headsets with the old ones but the main unit was what I really needed to replace and it works okay with my old headsets. Someday I hope to get them all coordinated so I will have all working together!
customer_reviews.author: A Miller

customer_reviews.title: a nice phone system
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice phone, easy to work. The only thing I don't like is there is no where to turn down the volume of people that are leaving a message. For example, your busy and don't want to hear the voicemail and you can't turn it down. Otherwise it is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: If you are searching? Stop and buy this
customer_reviews.text: I only have 1 experience of handsets before this one, but is like night and day. This set I recommend to everyone. Is perfect, practical and easy to see the display. Volume is great and answeing base is very intuitive, less intuitive are the units menu. Recommend to read the instructions to learn the functions. Price perfect. I kept one of the unit off of the charging base for more then 10 days and the battery is still fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Giuliana Z.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy and nicely surprised
customer_reviews.text: This phone has great buttons that actually work. We had the cheaper brand and the buttons were very strange in that they didn't work a lot of the time like it didn't register especially when having to type in a number to an automated machine. This also has a great large backlit display which is awesome. Overall it looks great and hopefully will last a long time. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: namaste_24

customer_reviews.title: Love Quiet Mode!
customer_reviews.text: These phones are great! One thing I love is the quiet mode. Hit the # key, enter hours of quiet and no more late night phone calls or early calls on the weekend. The answering system will still record messages, but I no longer feel guilty for now answering the phone, even if I don't want to talk at that time.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for seniors
customer_reviews.text: I sent this phone to my sister and she loves it. The numbers are large. But the best part is it holds 50 phone numbers so you can save land and cell numbers on this device. The price was right too.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia D.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: Great phone!!! I got this as a gift for my parents and they love it!! Nice big numbers on the face plate and easy to see read out. Built in answering machine and 2 remote handsets. Can't beat it! Good quality and arrived in 2 days.. love my Prime!!!
customer_reviews.author: OMG Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone n recorder. Good price and the large display is great
customer_reviews.text: These phones are nice n big display and i have inly 1 complaint is you cant turn ringer in handset off n it stays off u have to change that all the time cause it switches back on. Nice phone can hear good.
customer_reviews.author: cat

product_meta.title: AT&T CRL82212 DECT 6.0 Phone Answering System with Caller ID/Call Waiting, 2 Cordless Handsets, Black/Silver
product_meta.description: Size:2 Handsets| Style:2 Cordless HandsetsAT&T CRL82212 offers several features that will make retrieving messages, answering calls and storing information easier. This phone system, which supports up to four cordless handsets, also has a conference call option. Keeping up with your contacts is easy with the AT&T cordless phone; store up to 50 names and numbers in the phone's internal phone book directory. You can retrieve up to 10 of your latest calls with its quick redial feature.
feature_bullets: Extra-large buttons with backlit keys make the keypad easy to use
Visual ringing indicator and expandable to 12 handsets
50 name and number phone book directory
Note: Kindly refer user guide below for trouble shooting tips

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,651 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
